message: I occasionally drink coffee but most of the time it's of tea.
I'm coffee, most definitely. I do drink tea, but if I don't have my morning cup of Joe, I'm not fit for public interaction.  What about you?
I tried the tea route and do love it but I am a coffee person
No coffee for me. I drink tea occasionally but my morning routine revolves around one of these... https://img.skitch.com/20110210-pj42g9a3w4n3sjmyfyuq9kjm6u.jpg
i drink mainly sweet iced tea.. but ill have a frappe or latte when i need to wakeup
Since Janine is a big time coffee drinker, it's been coffee lately. When I'm on my own, it's all tea all the time.

Neither. Coffee often gives me a headache (or at least, little enjoyment). Tea doesn't taste horrible, but I haven't found any that really makes me want more either (then again, I haven't been too adventurous in trying tea).
I'm a bit of a hypocrite. I prefer tea, and the whole experience around preparing tea. But, I lazily reach for coffee more often because it is easy... and most cafés don't do tea well.
@michaelschade If you haven't tried puerh yet, I'd recommend you give it a try. Here's a decent starter version: http://amzn.to/g2Gv9g
@Thomasknoll Thanks, I'll definitely look into giving it a shot.
Tea all the way. White, red, green, and oolong. I'm pretty much an Adagio man.
Tea at home or restaurants, coffee on the go.
@spencer we also keep PG Tips in the office for our UK co-workers... and myself
Coffee. I very rarely drink tea now I'm in the USA, though a colleague does have a box of PG Tips on his desk :-)
Coffee. Hard to resist when you pass so many coffee shops on just one block. (Seattle)
how about a mix of tea and coffee
I enjoy both, but drink coffee more often. It's probably due to the fact that I prefer green and herbal teas more than black, so when caffeine is needed coffee is the answer.
